Package infodynamics.measures.mixed.gaussian

Class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceGaussian

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.mixed.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon
      • infodynamics.measures.mixed.gaussian.ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceGaussian
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSource, java.lang.Cloneable
    public class ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceGaussian
extends ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon
implements java.lang.Cloneable

    Computes the differential conditional mutual information of a given multivariate set of observations with a discrete variable, conditioned on another multivariate set of observations, assuming that the probability distribution function for these continuous observations is a multivariate Gaussian distribution.

    This is done by examining the conditional probability distribution for the multivariate continuous variable C (given the discrete variable D) against the probability distribution for C, all conditioned on another continuous variable Z: MI(C;D|Z) := H(C|Z) - H(C|D,Z).

    CAVEAT EMPTOR: The real question this type of calculation asks is to what extent does knowing the value of the discrete variable reduce variance in the continuous variable(s), given the other known continuous variable. Indeed, it may not to behave (I should test this--) as we would normally expect a mutual information calculation: if we add more continuous variables in, it may increase in spite of redundancy between these variables. TODO Further exploration should take place here ...

    These calculators are EXPERIMENTAL -- not properly tested, and not well documented. The intended calling pattern is similar to ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate

    Usage:

    1. Construct #ConditionalMutualnfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceGaussian()
    2. initialise(int, int, int)
    3. Set properties using ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon.setProperty(String, String)
    4. Provide the observations to the calculator using: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon.setObservations(double[][], int[], double[][]), or a sequence of: ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon.startAddObservations(), multiple calls to ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon.addObservations(double[][], int[], double[][]) and then finaliseAddObservations().
    5. Compute the required information-theoretic results, primarily: computeAverageLocalOfObservations() to return the average differential entropy based on the variance of the supplied observations; or other calls to compute local values or statistical significance.

    Alters behaviour slightly from parent class ConditionalMutualInfoMultiVariateCommon in that property ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariate.PROP_NORMALISE is set to false by default here (since this makes more sense for linear-Gaussian analysis).

    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)
    See Also:
    Differential entropy for Gaussian random variables at Mathworld, Differential entropy for Gaussian random variables at Wikipedia, Multivariate normal distribution on Wikipedia

      • clone

        protected java.lang.Object clone()
                          throws java.lang.CloneNotSupportedException
        Clone the object - note: while it does create new cloned instances of the EntropyCalculatorMultiVariateGaussian objects, I think these only have shallow copies to the data. This is enough though to maintain the structure across various ConditionalMutualInfoCalculatorMultiVariateWithDiscreteSourceCommon.computeSignificance(boolean, int) calls.
